intro: Astragalus echegarayi, commonly known as the Echegaray milkvetch, is a flowering plant species native to the arid and semi-arid regions of South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. Astragalus echegarayi plays a role in soil stabilization and provides forage for certain wildlife species. Its botanical features reflect its evolutionary adaptation to the challenging climates of its native habitat.
